name: James Harden
tip: Harden's the clear number 1 option if he stays in Houston and he's motivated, but right now his motivation is being questioned. I won't blame you for taking somebody else with the number 1 pick

name: Anthony Davis
tip: If LeBron misses time early it'll be the Anthony Davis show in LA. Has an elite fantasy game and an ever improving 3-point shot

name: Karl-Anthony Towns
tip: An elite fantasy player who managed to up his three-pointers made from 1.8 to 3.3 per-game without hurting his FG%. Should be happier on the court with his close friend D'Angelo Russell on the roster

name: Stephen Curry
tip: Steph is a career 47.6% shooter from the field, so the 40.2% from last season (5 game sample size) was an outlier

name: Damian Lillard
tip: Continues to return top-5 value, but is often not taken until the end of the first round

name: Kawhi Leonard
tip: An elite per-game fantasy player. His on-going knee issues might be an issue in a compacted fantasy schedule, but he'll still be a top-8 fantasy player

name: Nikola Jokic
tip: Skinny Jokic is a baller, but cevapi remains undefeated, so we'll see how he looks coming into next season. Still a top-10 player in any format, regardless of weight

name: Trae Young
tip: The addition of Capela means more assists. Expect another strong season as Young continues to develop into a fantasy first-round staple

name: Luka Doncic
tip: Went from being a liability in both shooting %s in his rookie season to shooting 46.3% from FG% and 75.8% from FT% in his second season. If he can edge his FT% up a little he'll be an early to mid-first-round guy for seasons to come.

name: Devin Booker
tip: His game keeps on getting better every season. Finished 12th in per-game value last season so if you can get him in the second-round then you've got yourself a steal

name: Joel Embiid
tip: He's a top fantasy player when he's switched on. Target him in a trade when he has a stretch of lower than expected output. Still a top-15 guy

name: Kyrie Irving
tip: The talent is always going to be there, it's just a matter of whether he can stay on the court.

name: Giannis Antetokounmpo
tip: His FT% almost dipped down to his FG% last season, but if you're drafting Giannis you're punting FT%, and he's the best fantasy player in punt FT% builds

name: Paul George
tip: His value is running low after a lackluster playoff performance. A much better performer during the regular season, which is what counts for fantasy basketball

name: Deandre Ayton
tip: Has the potential to be a top-25 player this season if he can up his output in any of his negative value categories (3PM, AST, or STL)

name: LeBron James
tip: LeBron Rule 101: Don't write him off as an elite fantasy player until his body actually breaks down. Might miss games early as LA prepares for another championship run

name: Jimmy Butler
tip: Butler seems to be in a happy place with the hard-working Heat. He seems more willing to share the workload, which doesn't bode well for fantasy output. Still, somebody to target at the end of the second round
injury: Game Time Decision

name: Jayson Tatum
tip: Improved his scoring from 15,7 to 23.4, and if his playoff run was anything to go by he's due for another small increase as he becomes the focus on the offensive end.

name: Bam Adebayo
tip: The Bam break-out happened last season. Expect the offense to continue running through his hands as he establishes himself as a top-30 fantasy player

name: Kristaps Porzingis
tip: His FG% will always be an issue since almost half of his field-goal attempts are from behind the arc, but he makes up for it with his elite shot-blocking. Injuries are the only thing limiting his upside
injury: Expected to be out until at least Jan 9

name: Jusuf Nurkic
tip: Will be better for the run during the resumption of the NBA season, and the starting job in Portland is his, so long as he's healthy. Should be back to 2018-19 Nurkic this season

name: Kevin Durant
tip: If players are forced to play a compact schedule then you can expect Brooklyn to be a little cautious with Durant

name: Nikola Vucevic
tip: His membership has been revoked from the 1-1-1 club (averaging 1 3-pointer, 1 steal, and 1 block), but he's working on getting it back

name: Khris Middleton
tip: Shot 3% above his second-best FG% season, so it's questionable whether he'll be able to sustain shooting at 49.7% from the field, but he has an uber-friendly fantasy game even if he doesn't

name: Bradley Beal
tip: Westbrook getting traded to Washington is going to impact Beal's usage, so expect dips across the board in points, rebounds, and assists

name: John Collins
tip: Capela and Gallinari will impact his output, but he's got great shooting %s, which will keep his value high as his counting stats take a dip from last season

name: Zach LaVine
tip: It's debatable whether LaVine is a good-stats-bad-team guy, but you can't deny the numbers he's putting up and should continue to flirt with top 30-40 value this season.

name: Rudy Gobert
tip: Sometimes players have the reputation of being such a good defender, that teams shoot less around them, and that's what's happening to Gobert. He's still an elite shot-blocker

name: Russell Westbrook
tip: Westbrook's shooting percentages are looking good now that he's attempting fewer 3-pointers and attacking the rim more. Expect his assists to bounce up a little without having to share the ball as much with Beal as he did with Harden

name: Ben Simmons
tip: An elite fantasy player in punt FT% builds, but it's hard to see him become a top-20 fantasy player until he starts to work on developing his outside game

name: Kyle Lowry
tip: Had one of the best fantasy seasons of his career, and played a career-high in minutes. All at the age of 34
injury: Game Time Decision

name: Chris Paul
tip: The history of small, 35-year-old point guards isn't on his side, but you can't deny the season he just had in OKC

name: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander
tip: He has managed to improve his fantasy output while maintaining his solid shooting percentages. Will be a quality fantasy option for years to come

name: Fred VanVleet
tip: NBA Finals Fred has evolved into Regular Season VanVleet, and he's a fantasy stud. He'll continue to play a key role in Toronto moving forward

name: Donovan Mitchell
tip: Has a great playoff performance and should continue to improve his fantasy output this season, but his lack of defensive numbers limit his ability to return top-25 value

name: DeMar DeRozan
tip: Still manages to be a top-50 fantasy producer even though he refuses to attempt three-point shots

name: Andre Drummond
tip: He's back in Cleveland this season, which is one of the few teams he's still able to produce top fantasy numbers on

name: Pascal Siakam
tip: Didn't handle the pressure of playoff basketball too well, but he had an off-season to work on it, and won't face the same pressure during the regular season

name: Jamal Murray
tip: It feels like his playoff bubble performance is going to inflate his value a little too much heading into fantasy drafts

name: LaMarcus Aldridge
tip: As consistent as they come, and still has another season of high-level play in him, whether it's in San Antonio or another on another roster

name: Domantas Sabonis
tip: He's clearly the best big-man on the roster, and his game meshes extremely well with the other starters in Indiana. Expect his high output to continue into this season

name: D'Angelo Russell
tip: Is in a happier scenario in Minnesota, but there's a chance some of his usage gets eaten into with the player who comes in with the number 1 pick
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Brook Lopez
tip: Brook has found a way to extend his career as a 3-point sniper who's capable of hitting 2+ threes and getting 2+ blocks a game

name: Brandon Ingram
tip: Has proven that he's more than capable of continuing to stuff the stat sheet alongside a healthy Zion

name: Jaren Jackson Jr
tip: His output has been inconsistent to date, so expect some quiet games, but his upside is huge. May not reach it this season, but I'm expecting improvements from JJJ heading into his third season
injury: Expected to be out until at least Jan 22

name: Christian Wood
tip: Westbrook being traded opens up the opportunity for Wood to play a bigger role in Houston's offense

name: Robert Covington
tip: The move to PF did wonders for his already excellent fantasy game (REB went up to 8 and BLK went up to 2.2 per game in a 22 game regular season sample size in Houston)

name: De'Aaron Fox
tip: His good categories are good (48% from the field, 21.1 PTS, 1.5 STL last season), but his bad ones are bad (70.5% from the line). If he can improve on his consistency then he's a chance to break into the top-50

name: Myles Turner
tip: He's not a strong rebounder, and playing next to Sabonis isn't going to help that, but what he does provide is elite shot-blocking, the ability to hit 3s, and not hurt you too much from the free-throw line
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Ja Morant
tip: Had a great rookie season. My only concern is with how ferocious he attacks the rim, given his slender frame. Capable of averaged 20 PTS and 8 AST heading into his second season

name: Jrue Holiday
tip: He's back to playing at an elite level and has minimal competition at either of the guard spots in Milwaukee

name: Brandon Clarke
tip: Put up top-100 value playing 22 minutes a game last season and is set for his role to increase. Has a fantasy-friendly game with elite FG%

name: Jonas Valanciunas
tip: Finished 52nd in per-game value last season, but Memphis has JJJ and Clarke capable of playing minutes at C. Should still return top 80-90 value this season

name: Collin Sexton
tip: At this point, we need to stop looking at Sexton as a PG. He's a score-first combo-guard, who still has potential to improve his assist numbers. He hasn't shown it yet, though
injury: Game Time Decision

name: CJ McCollum
tip: Goes from cold-shooting stretches to hitting everything as frequently as any player I've seen in the league (last season there were 3 individual months where he shot 48%+ from the field and 3 individual months where he shot 44% or lower).

name: Tobias Harris
tip: Continues to be a roto-friendly player who won't hurt you in any categories

name: Derrick White
tip: His reputation exceeds his output, but when he's producing he's capable of being a top-75 fantasy player
injury: Expected to be out until at least Jan 7

name: Jaylen Brown
tip: Almost doubled his PTS from last season and increased his output across the board

name: Dejounte Murray
tip: His production started to pick up towards the end of last season, but he's still limited as a fantasy player until he improves his scoring. Can still be a top-80 player without needing to score more than 10 PPG

name: Gordon Hayward
tip: When he plays, he plays well, but it becomes a little harder to trust his health with every new injury
injury: Game Time Decision

name: TJ Warren
tip: I feel like his bubble performance has inflated his value, but his plantar fasciitis injury could see him miss time early in the season
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 22

name: Thomas Bryant
tip: His lack of defensive effort is starting to become noticeable, but it would be a hard task for anybody asked to be the defensive anchor on this roster. Best suited as a second-unit big man who feasts on weaker lineups, but is more than capable of being a long-term starter

name: Lonzo Ball
tip: Looks like playing with Zion has had a positive impact on his fantasy output, but his shooting %s continue to be horrible and he'll slide in drafts given his play in the bubble

name: Buddy Hield
tip: There's still a little more growth left in his game, but he needs to up his steal rate to take his fantasy game to the next level

name: Malcolm Brogdon
tip: Was putting up elite numbers before Oladipo returned and then settled into a top-100 guy, which is where you can expect his output to hover around this season

name: Mitchell Robinson
tip: The Mitchell Robinson rollercoaster is set to continue for another season. The potential is there, but he needs to get better on the defensive end (and stop biting at every shot attempt)

name: Al Horford
tip: Has a chance to revive his career in OKC and should play a role as secondary ball facilitator in the starting line-up

name: Norman Powell
tip: Took a little longer to step-up his game, but he finally got there. Should be flirting with top-80 production if he continues to see 25+ minutes a game

name: Wendell Carter Jr
tip: A roto-friendly big man who can get you clean shooting percentages. Didn't play well under Boylen, but a better coach should be able to get more out of him

name: Lauri Markkanen
tip: Injuries and missed games continue to hurt Lauri's fantasy value. He could slide in drafts if people are only looking at his numbers from last season

name: Richaun Holmes
tip: Everybody's per-minute darling finally scored himself a starting role last season, but he won't be returning top 50 value again with Whiteside fighting him for minutes at C

name: Mikal Bridges
tip: I like what Mikal provides long-term as a 3&D specialist, and his offensive production has started trending in the right direction

name: Eric Bledsoe
tip: Has a chance to revive his career on the fast-paced Pelicans roster

name: Kevin Love
tip: Missed games will continue to be an issue for Love heading into the season as he finds himself playing next to somebody who has a tendancy of stealing rebounds from teammates
injury: Game Time Decision

name: Clint Capela
tip: Atlanta has suddenly become very deep at the big man spot

name: Zion Williamson
tip: We're starting to see flashes of what he's capable of, and those flashes are of a top fantasy prospect. We may not see it this season, but the potential to be elite is there

name: Bojan Bogdanovic
tip: He can score, and he's doing that in Utah, but all of his value is tied to 3 categores (PTS, 3PM, FT%)

name: Victor Oladipo
tip: Is in a weird situation in Indiana, and may find himself on a new roster to start this season. He's a few seasons out from his one elite fantasy season and it's doubtful he'll be able to replicate his 2017-18 numbers

name: Daniel Theis
tip: A solid end-of-roster guy who will put up decent numbers so long as he continues to start

name: Draymond Green
tip: Will be motivated to bounce back from a forgettable season last year, but he'll still be a negative contributor in all 3 shooting categories (FG%, FT%, PTS)
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 22

name: Darius Bazley
tip: Had a good enough bubble performance that suggests minutes will open up for Bazley to start at PF

name: Elfrid Payton
tip: We've seen this movie before. He often starts the season slowly, then, when the season is lost he goes on a tear to finish the season

name: Kemba Walker
tip: A 4-category player who's best suited to punt FG% builds
injury: Expected to be out until at least Jan 10

name: Jarrett Allen
tip: Deserves to play more minutes than he does and will again be sharing minutes at C with Jordan

name: Hassan Whiteside
tip: Whiteside is coming back from having a very Whiteside season (putting up elite rebounds, blocks, and FG%), but he'll likely be splitting minutes at C in Sacramento

name: John Wall
tip: Will start the season slow given his return from injury, but I don't see his role changing much in Houston given he was always going to be playing second fiddle in Washington

name: Michael Porter Jr
tip: Injuries will always be a concern, but Denver's best chance to jump to the next level is with MPJ improving and becoming a quality starter, so the opportunity is there so long as his body holds up

name: Marcus Smart
tip: His value increases dramatically in a punt FG% build

name: Kelly Oubre Jr
tip: It's not as good as OKC, but I still like the fit in Golden State

name: Duncan Robinson
tip: An elite shooter who doesn't provide anything outside of the scoring and shooting categories

name: Mike Conley
tip: It was a season to forget for Conley, but his performance in the playoffs suggests he's going to bounce back

name: Josh Richardson
tip: Had a down season in Philly, but we know he's capable of more. I like the move to Dallas and he's somebody to target late in drafts

name: Delon Wright
tip: The steals are playing time are available in Detroit, but his value tends to hover around the end-of-roster territory

name: Evan Fournier
tip: Should be available late in fantasy drafts and is a stable source of production in PTS and 3PM

name: OG Anunoby
tip: Has the potential to be a top-100 staple as he continues to develop his game, mostly because of his defensive numbers

name: Serge Ibaka
tip: Added a three-point shot to his game, which will help extend his career. Should be returning top-100 value in LA
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 22

name: Nerlens Noel
tip: It looks like the starting spot at C could be in play, but even if it is, it'll still be a minutes split between Noel and Robinson
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Maxi Kleber
tip: A good streaming option, but not somebody to rely on

name: Derrick Rose
tip: Will Derrick Rose continue to shoot 49% from the field this season? Probably not, but he provides great value for somebody who can be had late in drafts

name: Steven Adams
tip: Didn't live up to most people's expectations last season, and his scoring is trending in the wrong direction, but he's still a good fantasy player in punt FT% builds and you won't have to draft him early

name: JJ Redick
tip: Will provide much-needed outside shooting for New Orleans this season, but at this point in his career, he doesn't offer much outside of 3PM, PTS, and FT%

name: Lou Williams
tip: Is a walking bucket, but his fantasy production is tied to 4 categories and doesn't provide any defensive stats

name: Jerami Grant
tip: The transition to a starting role we've all been waiting for looks likely to happen in Detroit

name: Rui Hachimura
tip: He's still a little raw, but he's the best young player on the roster, so he'll continue to see minutes
injury: Game Time Decision

name: Otto Porter Jr
tip: Otto's value is at an all-time low after a horrible 2019-20 season. Has proven to be a stable fantasy player in prior seasons and could provide value on draft day

name: Markelle Fultz
tip: If we're starting with a clean slate and treated last season as his rookie season, then he's off to a good start, and he has shown signs of becoming a good rotation player

name: Terry Rozier
tip: Potentially moves to the bench and is a chance to get traded given how crowded Charlotte is at the guard spot

name: PJ Washington
tip: Has a nice overall game without being a standout in any category. Should continues to increase his output heading into season two

name: Aaron Gordon
tip: Don't mind me, I'm just here waiting for Aaron Gordon to remember how to play basketball again

name: Devonte' Graham
tip: Started the season red hot, but started to slow down once teams focused on him as Charlotte's best offensive weapon. Won't get as much attention this season with Hayward on the roster, but his production is expected to dip with such a crowded guard rotation

name: DeAndre Jordan
tip: Will be splitting minutes with Allen this season, but should still be able to produce respectable rebounding numbers if you're desperate for them

name: Bogdan Bogdanovic
tip: Has a well-rounded fantasy game and should be locked in as a starter for Atlanta

name: Ivica Zubac
tip: Is capable of being a top 100 player, but his minutes are capped with Ibaka's ability to play C

name: Alec Burks
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Davis Bertans
tip: Flirted with top-80 value last season, mostly because of his 3.7 three-pointers made per game. His ceiling is capped until he starts contributing to non-shooting categories

name: Julius Randle
tip: Thibs has a habit of playing guys he likes heavy minutes, but the fit with Toppin isn't ideal for him

name: Kevon Looney
tip: There's plenty of room for improvement, but he has the opportunity to cement himself as a 22-24 minute per game starter

name: Marvin Bagley III
tip: We're starting to see a concerning pattern with Bagley. He gets hurt, comes back and does some nice things, and then misses more games. He has the potential to be a walking double-double, but he needs to find a way to stay on the court

name: Danilo Gallinari
tip: Capable of giving you a quality return in PTS and FT%, but Atlanta isn't a great fit. He's not mobile enough to play SF full time, and Atlanta already has a quality starting PF

name: Killian Hayes
tip: Landed in the absolute best spot in terms of fantasy production, and should be the opening night starter on a team starting their re-build

name: Nemanja Bjelica
tip: A stop-gap until Bagley works things out, but he has value in the short-term as a streaming option

name: Marc Gasol
tip: Might get the gentleman's start at C, but I can't see him playing enough minutes to crack the top-100

name: Blake Griffin
tip: His value is at an all-time low, and it's questionable how his body will hold up this season, but he's still capable of putting up numbers without relying on athletisism (averated 2.5 3PM in 2018-19 and 1.5 last season)

name: Patrick Beverley
tip: He's the perfect PG for this Clippers roster, but at this point in his career, he doesn't have much upside in fantasy

name: Donte DiVincenzo
tip: He's proving to be a good end-of-roster 3s and steals guy, but he doesn't do enough in other categories

name: Tyler Herro
tip: Should be playing 30+ minutes a night heading into season two, but chances are he'll be over-drafted due to his playoff run

name: Paul Millsap
tip: Not much long-term appeal here as he's clearly in the twilight of his career

name: Terrence Ross
tip: He's a 3-point streamer when his shot is falling

name: DeMarcus Cousins
tip: Cousins will have to prove he's healthy before we can consider him a viable fantasy option this season

name: Coby White
tip: Coby White's game is the definition of a rollercoaster ride, but it's one you want to be taking in punt FG% builds

name: Larry Nance Jr
tip: Can put up numbers when spot-starting, but hasn't shown any indication of being anything more than a high energy guy off the bench
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Malik Beasley
tip: He ended his season in Minnesota on a tear, but rotations are getting crowded in Minnesota

name: Jordan Clarkson
tip: A gunner off the bench, but he provides very little in terms of non-scoring categories

name: Will Barton
tip: We've seen this movie before. He's still capable of getting hot, but Denver are better off moving him to a bench role

name: Ricky Rubio
tip: A great steals and assists option who can be had late in drafts

name: Kevin Porter Jr
tip: Looked the best of the Cleveland rookies last season and had a promising stretch of games before getting injured, but Okoro limits his time at SF

name: Chris Boucher
tip: He's older than most people think, but he's somebody to stream in when you need blocks

name: Montrezl Harrell
tip: Doesn't provide anything outside of the typical big-man stats and Gasol limits his ability to play big minutes at C

name: JaVale McGee
tip: At this point in his career, on this roster, he's nothing more than a blocks streamer or end-of-roster big man
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 18

name: Tyrese Haliburton
tip: Has the size and shooting ability to play SG and is an excellent fit next to Fox

name: LaMelo Ball
tip: I won't be surprised if we see a lot of 3-guard line-ups in Charlotte, but Hayward takes the ball out of his hands, and LaMelo is at his best when he's handling the ball

name: Seth Curry
tip: We should see the same amount of minutes from Seth this season whether it's as a fringe starter or gunner off the bench, but he's not much more than a 3PM streamer or end-of-bench guy

name: Aron Baynes
tip: The starting spot should be his and the Raptors inherit the best fan account on Twitter

name: Miles Bridges
tip: Potentially comes off the bench next season and the addition of Hayward limits his ability to break out

name: Darius Garland
tip: He hasn't had a great start to his career but should improve heading into season two (even if his FG% doesn't)

name: Andrew Wiggins
tip: Wiggins is Golden States' problem now, but I have more faith in him playing within an offense for the Warriors than any other roster

name: PJ Tucker
tip: The lone center on the roster (who's really a SF/PF) is expected to play as many minutes as his body can handle. Still, only a borderline top-100 guy even if he's playing 35 minutes a night

name: Cody Zeller
tip: The often injured Zeller is younger than you think, and when he's fit and firing he provides end of the roster value, but that's not often enough (hasn't played more than 62 games since his rookie season in 2013-14).

name: James Wiseman
tip: Expecting him to split minutes at C with his minutes gradually increasing as the season goes on
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 22

name: Derrick Jones Jr
tip: Has apparently won the starting spot in Portland, but don't expect him to put up big numbers

name: Dwight Powell
tip: His output will increase when Porzingis is out of the lineup, but he's not somebody to rely on

name: Joe Harris
tip: Harris will get plenty of open looks as teams focus their defensive efforts on Kyrie and KD

name: Joe Ingles
tip: His fantasy output has started to regress, but the assists and 3-pointers should still be there

name: Tim Hardaway Jr
tip: His ceiling is capped, and it doesn't look like he'll be more than a contributor to the PTS, 3PM, and FT% categories

name: Royce O'Neale
tip: His ceiling is being able to spot-start as a low usage defensive specialist

name: Harrison Barnes
tip: Doesn't provide much outside of points and 3s and has little upside moving forward. There are more exciting picks to make

name: Jeremy Lamb
tip: Is capable of putting up numbers when given the opportunity to play, but he's not somebody a team is willing to start long-term so his minutes will always be capped
injury: Expected to be out until at least Jan 17

name: Mo Bamba
tip: Has yet to prove that he's anything more than a blocks specialist at this early stage of his career
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Trevor Ariza
tip: Wouldn't be surprised if he's traded again before the season officially starts
injury: Game Time Decision

name: Gary Harris
tip: It's time to accept Harris for what he is - a decent real-life NBA player, but a below-average fantasy player.

name: Dennis Schroder
tip: Had a dramatic increase in output last season, but his usage won't be as high in LA
injury: Game Time Decision

name: Goran Dragic
tip: Don't expect bubble Dragic to return this season

name: Matisse Thybulle
tip: A defensive stud, but he needs to develop a three-point shot to keep himself on the court

name: Troy Brown Jr
tip: Didn't really take the opportunity on a depleted Washington roster last season, but still has some untapped potential

name: Spencer Dinwiddie
tip: Dinwiddie's output this season is tied to whether he remains on the Nets roster. If he stays in Brooklyn then he'll still be productive, but he won't be putting up top-80 value.

name: Danuel House Jr
tip: Didn't have the best on-court (and off-court) bubble experience and he's not somebody to rely on in standard leagues

name: Keldon Johnson
tip: He's behind quite a few players on the depth chart in San Antonio, so his opportunity is limited in the short-term, but he has the potential to be a good 2-way player
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 30

name: Robert Williams
tip: In a position battle for the back-up C spot, which doesn't bode well for his fantasy output

name: Josh Okogie
tip: His shooting percentages improved from his rookie season and should continue to develop. His upside seems limited, though

name: Cam Reddish
tip: His streaky shooting means he's best suited to punt FG% builds

name: Svi Mykhailiuk
tip: One of the better shooters on the Detroit roster, but he needs to add more elements to his game to be fantasy relevant

name: Danny Green
tip: A 3-point streamer who's still capable of getting close to a steal and block a game, but he's not somebody to look at unless you're in a deep league

name: Gary Trent Jr
tip: Is currently showing signs of being a capable rotation player when given the minutes

name: Dario Saric
tip: If Baynes signs with another team the role of a back-up stretch-5 is his
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Tomas Satoransky
tip: More of an end-of-roster kind of guy who's capable of putting up stable numbers when filling in for an injured player
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Derrick Favors
tip: Moves to a bench role in Utah

name: Anthony Edwards
tip: His athletic ability allows him to get to the rim, and when he's not driving he's taking 3s (and sometimes too deep), but he tends to go missing during play and shot a poor % in college

name: Caris LeVert
tip: I wouldn't be shocked to see Caris on a new team at some point next season as the fit with a Kyrie and KD led Brooklyn Nets roster isn't a great one

name: Kevin Huerter
tip: Is developing a nice all-around fantasy game, but his FG% will hurt you

name: Dillon Brooks
tip: Has just scored himself a new 3-year contract, which means he's definitely in Memphis' long-term plans, but his game doesn't translate well to fantasy

name: Shake Milton
tip: His upside is capped on the talented Philly roster, but he should see minutes as a spot-started as they continue to tinker with their lineup

name: Frank Ntilikina
tip: Best case scenario Frank becomes a Marcus Smart type player, worst case scenario he remains a Knick for the rest of his career
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: De'Anthony Melton
tip: Seems set to continue playing 20 minutes as a backup

name: Enes Kanter
tip: Kanter relies on specific match-ups to get minutes

name: Cameron Johnson
tip: Showed enough last season to earn himself a spot in the rotation as a back-up stretch-4

name: Moritz Wagner
tip: At best, he's an end of your fantasy roster kind of guy

name: RJ Barrett
tip: Let's hope RJ is currently in a gym working on his shooting, because if he can somehow become a respectable shooter, then he's a chance to be a good fantasy player. Until then, he's better suited to points-leagues

name: Monte Morris
tip: Has failed to build on his promising rookie season and it looks like his upside is capped as a bench player

name: Tristan Thompson
tip: Should split minutes at C with Theis, but he needs big minutes to be fantasy relevant
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Jeff Teague
tip: Might have some value if he spot-starts since Kemba tends to miss games

name: Jabari Parker
tip: He finds himself in a situation where he plays the same position as an important piece of his new team (again), but this time that piece is the often injured Marvin Bagley. Could have some value in the short-term when Bagley is hurt (which happens often)
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Onyeka Okongwu
tip: I was hoping Okongwu landed to a team looking for a starting big-man, but, he, unfortunately, fell to a team with John Collins and Clint Capela. It might be a season or two before he gets the opportunity to play big minutes
injury: Game Time Decision

name: Thaddeus Young
tip: Lauri Markkanen is often injured, so Young still has short-term value as a spot-starter
injury: Expected to be out until at least Dec 23

name: Obi Toppin
tip: The fit with Randle isn't great, but you have to assume they drafted Toppin for a reason, and that's to score

name: Gorgui Dieng
tip: A streamer when he spot-starts, otherwise he's somebody to avoid
